function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Restricting inter-city connections via railways may prevent the further spread of COVID-19 in most cities of all levels.","Impact":"Effective control of population flow is necessary to suppress the spread of COVID-19.","Mitigation":"Implement strict population flow control measures and monitoring systems.","Technologies":"Monitoring technology, travel restrictions, and population tracking systems.","People":"Population in inter-city travel, local residents, and travelers.","Owner":"Government authorities, public health agencies, and transportation authorities."},{"Description":"Lowering the betweenness centrality could slow down the spread of future pandemics in over 70% of prefectural-level cities.","Impact":"Reducing betweenness centrality can help mitigate the spread of future pandemics in urban areas.","Mitigation":"Implement urban planning strategies to decrease betweenness centrality and redistribute transportation flow.","Technologies":"Urban planning software, traffic flow analysis tools, and geographical information systems (GIS).","People":"Urban planners, city officials, and transportation authorities.","Owner":"Local governments, urban planning agencies, and transportation departments."},{"Description":"Reducing the population densities of built-up areas could be effective in preventing the spread of future pandemics in approximately 70.00 % of the province capitals.","Impact":"Lowering population densities can reduce the risk of rapid disease transmission in densely populated areas.","Mitigation":"Implement urban zoning regulations, public health awareness campaigns, and incentivize decentralization.","Technologies":"Urban design software, population density mapping tools, and communication platforms.","People":"Residents of densely populated areas, public health advocates, and urban development stakeholders.","Owner":"Local governments, urban planning authorities, and public health organizations."}]}
